column4: Hey umm, I'm just a beginner and I could really use some help :/ My laptop can't connect to the internet, plz help?
It can't detect the LAN connection
did you go all script kiddie on the network confs after you first noticed? or the issue is something out of the box
I'm using ubuntu on a laptop, not a server. My internet works fine. Even the wire is fine.
please pastebin your /var/log/syslog if you would
if you would like we can do it via terminal and the process is will provide you with a link to share?
kay I got /var/kig/syslog now, but it's really long? are you sure you want me to paste it O.o
are you connected via hardwire right now?
connected to something? a router? buddies pc? the toaster?

done dinning? actually your system sees wlan, remember? all them wifi spots you tried to connect to? and  ethernet? i am guessing you dont have a connection to anything alive on ehternet, well, i cant say, your syslog did though
lol, it was lunch :P I detects wireless networks, I just can't connect to anyone of 'em, frankly I don't even which one os 'em is my own network
why wrapping a working wlan? i can show you your own syslog where it was working this afternoon my time, why not use what you were using then?
